abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of Tanzania's
            reform program is to stimulate the private sector's
            capacity to produce and deliver goods and services, while at
            the same time, limiting the role of the public sector in
            this area and strengthening instead, its capacity to manage
            the economy more effectively. Major areas of the program
            include macroeconomic management, public sector management,
            parastatal reform, private sector development,
            rehabilitation of infrastructure, human resource
            development, poverty alleviation, environmental management,
            and a strategy for reducing Tanzania's heavy debt burden.
